class_notes:
(Same as CPLT 389 1, FILM 385 2) "Spain: Cinema, Fascism, Religiosity" | A close analysis of the correspondences of cinema, fascism, and religiosity in Spain as national / transnational cultural productions. The course will focus on the ability of this artistic media to represent 1) engagement and propaganda of fascism and Catholicism, and resistance to it; 2) manipulation of historical memory, politics, and religion; 3) Spanish religious and political exceptionalism and foreign relations; and 4) the persistence of religiosity and imperial politics. Class discussion will revolve around the ways in which literary authors, philosophers, and filmmakers deploy strategies to represent these thematic referential axes. Emphasis for students registered in CPLT 389W is on theoretical analysis, for those registered in Film 398W is on national / transnational film; and for those registered in REL 385 is on film and religion / religiosity. The resulting interdisciplinary seminar will unfold as a comparative, interactive engagement of these areas of inquiry.


Weekly blogposts based on assigned readings, weekly films, and class discussion (30%).
Attendance and active participation in class discussion (30%).
Presentation / discussion lead (10%).
Final research project (30%).


NOTE: this course will meet online twice a week synchronously for 75 minutes of class discussion.  Students will watch the films assigned each week on their own before the Wednesday class session.
